alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 08 at 4:55PM PDT until September 10 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Increased risk for dangerous rip currents and larger breakers of 4 to 9 feet expected due to incoming southerly swell. * WHERE...Northern Monterey Bay and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Possible dangers to inexperienced swimmers, surfers, and anyone standing or walking in or close to the water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Larger southerly swell of 3 to 4 feet at 15 to 16 seconds will arrive Saturday morning. This swell originated from Hurricane Jova and could bring an increased risk of dangerous rip currents as well as elevated surf, particularly for south facing beaches, including Santa Cruz.
info.instruction: Never turn your back to the ocean! Sneaker waves can occur at any time without warning. It is safest to swim at a beach with lifeguards. If you are caught in a rip current, don`t try to swim against it. Instead, swim out of the current, parallel to the shore, and then back to shore. If you can`t swim, float or tread water, and yell or wave for help if you need assistance.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
